net.floodlightcontroller.core.internal

Class OFSwitchHandshakeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.floodlightcontroller.core.internal.OFSwitchHandshakeHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOFConnectionListener

    public class OFSwitchHandshakeHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements IOFConnectionListener
    Switch handler deals with the switch connection and dispatches switch messages to the appropriate locations. These messages are typically received by the channel handler first and piped here.

      Initial state before channel is connected.

      The switch is in MASTER role.

      Default implementation for message handlers in any state.
      class  OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.QuarantineState
      Switch is in a quarantine state.
      class  OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.SlaveState
      The switch is in SLAVE role.
      class  OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitAppHandshakeState 
      class  OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitConfigReplyState
      We are waiting for a config reply message.
      class  OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitDescriptionStatReplyState
      We are waiting for a OFDescriptionStat message from the switch.
      class  OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitInitialRoleState
      We are waiting for the initial role reply message (or error indication) from the switch.
      class  OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitPortDescStatsReplyState
      We are waiting for a features reply message.

      • messageWritten

        public void messageWritten(IOFConnectionBackend connection,
                  OFMessage m)
        Description copied from interface: IOFConnectionListener
        Primarily for role requests, we need a way to tell the OFSwitchHandshakeHandler that we've just sent a message (from e.g. a module). In this way, it'll list the request as pending and be able to receive and process the reply from messageReceived() later when the reply with the correct XID comes in. This will ensure the OFSwitchHandshakeHandler is always in the correct state.
        Specified by:
        messageWritten in interface IOFConnectionListener

      • isSwitchHandshakeComplete

        public boolean isSwitchHandshakeComplete(IOFConnectionBackend connection)
        Specified by:
        isSwitchHandshakeComplete in interface IOFConnectionListener
